docs.abstract: Concluding that actuarial standards for pensions were flawed, Mr. Gold embarked on a 30-year mission “to save my profession.”
docs.snippet: Concluding that actuarial standards for pensions were flawed, Mr. Gold embarked on a 30-year mission “to save my profession.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Jeremy Gold, an actuary who more than 25 years ago warned of the financial debacles now slowly playing out among the cities and states that sponsor pension plans for their teachers, police officers, bus drivers and other workers, died on July 6 in Manhattan. He was 75.

headline.main: Jeremy Gold, Actuary Who Warned of Pension Crisis, Dies at 75
headline.print_headline: Jeremy Gold, 75, Actuary, Is Dead; Foresaw Crisis in Public Pensions

docs.abstract: Working in the summer is less common among teenagers now as more do volunteer work or take classes. But as one educator said, “Summer jobs are a great idea.”
docs.snippet: Working in the summer is less common among teenagers now as more do volunteer work or take classes. But as one educator said, “Summer jobs are a great idea.”
docs.lead_paragraph: The share of teenagers working summer jobs had dwindled for years, but the numbers have come back a bit in the last couple of years. It’s a change applauded by educators and financial advisers alike.

headline.main: The Virtues of a Summer Job
headline.print_headline: Summer Jobs Can Teach Lessons That Last a Lifetime

docs.abstract: Mr. Schultz’s decision to retire from Starbucks, a plan he says he privately outlined to the board a year ago, could stoke speculation that he is considering a move into politics.
docs.snippet: Mr. Schultz’s decision to retire from Starbucks, a plan he says he privately outlined to the board a year ago, could stoke speculation that he is considering a move into politics.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Howard Schultz, the outspoken executive chairman of Starbucks, will leave the company at the end of the month, bringing to an end the tenure of a socially conscious entrepreneur who turned a local Seattle coffee chain into a global giant with more than 28,000 stores in 77 countries.

headline.main: Howard Schultz to Step Down as Starbucks Executive Chairman
headline.print_headline: Howard Schultz to Step Down as Starbucks Executive Chairman

docs.abstract: To promote diversity, big pension funds and college endowments could insist on equitable hiring practices at investment firms.
docs.snippet: To promote diversity, big pension funds and college endowments could insist on equitable hiring practices at investment firms.
docs.lead_paragraph: Frances McDormand, the actress who won an Academy Award this year for her performance in “Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri,” introduced much of the world to a new idea when she accepted her Oscar.

headline.main: Financial World’s A-List Could Take Hollywood’s Cue on Inclusion
headline.print_headline: Two Words For Wall Street: Inclusion Rider

docs.abstract: America Media, a 108-year-old Jesuit organization and the publisher of America magazine, needed a modern office for its operations that still reflected its faith.
docs.snippet: America Media, a 108-year-old Jesuit organization and the publisher of America magazine, needed a modern office for its operations that still reflected its faith.
docs.lead_paragraph: Communal tables. Teleconferencing hubs. Cafes where employees can grab coffee and flip open laptops for impromptu meetings. Marvel Architects, a New York design firm, has incorporated such commonly requested features into clients’ workplaces many times over.

headline.main: A New Home for a Publisher and Its Priests
headline.print_headline: Media Headquarters With Room to Report, Videotape and Worship

docs.abstract: Goldman Sachs said David Solomon will become its chief executive Oct. 1, replacing Lloyd Blankfein. But the change probably won’t alter the bank’s course.
docs.snippet: Goldman Sachs said David Solomon will become its chief executive Oct. 1, replacing Lloyd Blankfein. But the change probably won’t alter the bank’s course.
docs.lead_paragraph: During his weekly staff meeting at Goldman Sachs’s Manhattan headquarters on Tuesday morning, the firm’s head of digital finance noted that its president, David M. Solomon, had just been anointed the next chief executive.

headline.main: Goldman Names a New Chief. Don’t Expect Big Changes.

byline.original: By Kate Kelly and Andrew Ross Sorkin

docs.abstract: In a letter to the Federal Trade Commission, Edward J. Markey and Richard Blumenthal expressed concern that Samba TV wasn’t transparent with viewers about data it collected.
docs.snippet: In a letter to the Federal Trade Commission, Edward J. Markey and Richard Blumenthal expressed concern that Samba TV wasn’t transparent with viewers about data it collected.
docs.lead_paragraph: Two Democratic senators have asked federal regulators to investigate the business practices of smart-television manufacturers amid worries that companies are tracking consumers’ viewing behavior without their knowledge.

headline.main: Two Senators Call for Investigation of Smart TV Industry
headline.print_headline: Senators Urge Investigation of Smart TV Industry, Citing Privacy Concerns

docs.abstract: McDonald’s and Arby’s are among companies that have agreed to drop a hiring practice that keeps workers from moving between franchises within a chain.
docs.snippet: McDonald’s and Arby’s are among companies that have agreed to drop a hiring practice that keeps workers from moving between franchises within a chain.
docs.lead_paragraph: Seven major restaurant chains, including Arby’s, Carl’s Jr., McDonald’s and Jimmy John’s, agreed to drop a hiring practice that critics say may be keeping tens of thousands of fast-food workers locked in low-wage jobs.

headline.main: 7 Fast-Food Chains to End ‘No Poach’ Deals That Lock Down Low-Wage Workers
headline.print_headline: 7 Fast-Food Chains to End ‘No Poach’ Deals

docs.abstract: As Amazon continues its search for its second headquarters, some city officials wonder what was offered and how much it will cost taxpayers.
docs.snippet: As Amazon continues its search for its second headquarters, some city officials wonder what was offered and how much it will cost taxpayers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jared Evans, a member of the Indianapolis City-County Council, is proud that the city is among 20 finalists for one of the most coveted prizes in the country: the planned second headquarters of Amazon.

headline.main: Cities’ Offers for Amazon Base Are Secrets Even to Many City Leaders
headline.print_headline: Cost of Bids To Lure Amazon? See Example At Right:

docs.abstract: Samsung on Thursday took the wraps off the Galaxy Note9, its latest big-screen smartphone, even as it confronts a saturated market for the devices.
docs.snippet: Samsung on Thursday took the wraps off the Galaxy Note9, its latest big-screen smartphone, even as it confronts a saturated market for the devices.
docs.lead_paragraph: Apple recently became  a $1 trillion company, fueled partly by the growth from its iPhone. In contrast, its top competitor in smartphones, Samsung, has been dealing with slowing revenue from its signature Galaxy S9 smartphone.

headline.main: Samsung Unveils New Galaxy Note Smartphone Amid Slowing Sales
headline.print_headline: Samsung Rushes Out New Galaxy Note
